drawbacks of using the note 9 as my
camera over the past four days in the
Amazon the first drawback that stands
out is the fact that when I'm using the
back facing camera I get incredible 4k
resolution but one of the primary issues
is I don't know when my head is cut off
I don't know when I'm slightly out of
focus and so those things are a little
bit of a challenge you could set your
manual focus you could learn where to
position the camera but right off the
bat there is a bit of a learning curve
involved without being said though you
can of course use the front-facing
camera which does offer a full two point
7 K resolution not quite as good as the
back but still an excellent camera one
of the compromises you will be making
when filming with a cellphone camera is
gonna be dynamic range where I sometimes
felt the note 9 struggled was when I was
filming in the bright daylight if
something else in the frame was slightly
underexposed or dark I either lost all
the detail in the shadows or I had my
highlights blowing out another drawback
to using any cell phone camera is gonna
be that it's so light that it actually
is quite shaky unless you have a gimbal
you can get awesome gimbals for a
